name: Alila Manggis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort had been highly recommended by a couple of small tour operators but at first sight we were terribly disappointed. We had come from a villa hotel with private pool and the room at the Chedi was very small with tiny bathroom. The hotel has no beach so all sunbeds were in lines around the pool. That was all such a disappointment and so much so that we arranged to cut our stay from 5 nights to 4. However, after night we soon realised the charm of the place. The staff all went out of their way to have a chat with us and particularly to tell us about the East coast and the lifestyle there. The exec chef is new, was trained at the Savoy and is excellent. She was very keen to get feedback. There are lots of little surprises such as afternoon tea, excellent turn down service with hand made biscuits and a great spa with treatments that used products made locally and smelt good enough to eat. There was also a long list of possible trips, most of which were eco type and supported the local community.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel, but with downsides

reviews.title: So-so experience, in comparison to the other Alila at Ubud

likes.liked: — Breakfast (wide selection, small in quantity, but we are small 'eaters')

reviews.text: My wife and I took the "2 faces of Alila" at Bali for our honeymoon in Jan 2008 - 2 nites at Ubud, 2 at Manggis. Because of the wonderful experience at Ubud, the staff at Manggis is less attentive, slower and less willing to accommodate to our requests.
reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED

reviews.text: For example, there were only 2 bottles of complimentary water in the room upon arrival and when we asked for 4 more, the reception staff sounded surprise. "4 more?!" - exact quotation with a tone of exclamation. And that was our first call to reception for additional water... Well, Bali is a tropical and hot island that averages 30 degrees Celsius, yeah?!
reviews.title: Not just a hotel -- it's a great experience

likes.liked: — The staff, and definitely the food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location-wise, Manggis (in East Bali) is an hour and a half drive from Ubud (central part of the island where many interesting rice fields and temples are located) , and a good 2 hours' drive from the famous, touristy part of Kuta. There is absolutely no beach at Alila Manggis. So forget about beach activities. There is even a sign that reads "Dangerous". Of course, there is a swimming pool, but I won't say it is attractive, with limited number of deckchairs.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Because of the wayward location in Manggis, we hired a guide to take us around. The one offered by the hotel is more expensive than one we found when shopping around in Ubud a few days earlier - by ~USD30 and not very flexible with the timing. We were quite pleased with the one we found, who not only drove us around but doubled up as a guide. In the end, we tipped our driver/guide by the difference in the amount quoted by the hotel.
reviews.title: The perfect starting point to exploring Bali

reviews.text: The room is laid out in a modern decor. It was very clean and very spacious. There was a nice balcony with a day bed where one could spend many hours just chilling and reading a book. It had a great view of the pool and the beach. We had dinner at the edge of the property, really close to the sea, it was a magnificent experience in the evening with the tiki torches.
